in the kernel source tree drivers/net/sb1000.c is a cable modem driver
If you already feel comfortable with C and just want to learn about the kernel because you need to write a USB cable modem driver
'Linux Kernel Development' - 'Robert Love' is a decent book , if that's your kind of thing
http://kernelnewbies.org/ is a good place to start kernel development
But unless you have been programming for a long time in C don't expect to be able to write a driver anytime soon
No problem...Kernel Janitors also has a good list of tasks for people new to the kernel to work on to help them get familiar with the cod.e..
